abstract.p: Francine Fleishman letter says US ouster from United Nations Human Rights Commission (May 9 article) may be related to US withdrawal from Kyoto Protocol on global warming and its restarting of missile race

block.p: Dick Armey, the House majority leader, says it is an affront to the whole notion of human rights that the United States lost a seat on the United Nations Human Rights Commission (''House Threatens to Hold U.N. Dues in Loss of a Seat,'' front page, May 9).

Dick Armey, the House majority leader, says it is an affront to the whole notion of human rights that the United States lost a seat on the United Nations Human Rights Commission (''House Threatens to Hold U.N. Dues in Loss of a Seat,'' front page, May 9).

Perhaps, among other things, the other nations find that our backing out of the Kyoto Protocol, which would control worldwide levels of carbon dioxide, and our planned restarting of the missile race are affronts to the notion of human rights.
FRANCINE FLEISHMAN Lido Beach, N.Y., May 9, 2001
